instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay sets a timer called SpawnTimer that calls a custom event SpawnEnemy every 5 seconds.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnTimer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnEnemy", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=SpawnEnemy]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Enemy Spawned"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnTimer
PARENT: Actor
TIMER: Name=SpawnTimer, Time=5.0, Looping=true
EVENT: BeginPlay
NODE n1: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnEnemy", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
EXEC n1.Then -> Event_BeginPlay
EVENT: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=SpawnEnemy]
NODE n2: Print [InString="Spawning Enemy"]
EXEC Event_SpawnEnemy -> n2.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnTimer
PARENT: Actor
TIMER: Name=SpawnTimer, Time=5.0, Looping=true
EVENT: BeginPlay
NODE n1: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnEnemy", Time=5.0, Looping=true]
EXEC n1.Then -> Event_BeginPlay
EVENT: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=SpawnEnemy]
NODE n2: Print [InString="Spawning Enemy"]
EXEC Event_SpawnEnemy -> n2.Execute }

validation.error:
Line 0: Found 7 parse errors:
Line 3: Unknown directive: TIMER: Name=SpawnTim... | 'TIMER: Name=SpawnTimer, Time=5.0, Looping=true'
Line 4: Unknown directive: EVENT: BeginPlay... | 'EVENT: BeginPlay'
Line 5: NODE defined before GRAPH declaration | 'NODE n1: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnEnemy", Time=5.0, Looping=true]'
Line 6: EXEC defined before GRAPH declaration | 'EXEC n1.Then -> Event_BeginPlay'
Line 7: Unknown directive: EVENT: Event_CustomE... | 'EVENT: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=SpawnEnemy]'
Line 8: NODE defined before GRAPH declaration | 'NODE n2: Print [InString="Spawning Enemy"]'
Line 9: EXEC defined before GRAPH declaration | 'EXEC Event_SpawnEnemy -> n2.Execute }' | ''

instruction: Create a Blueprint that starts a looping timer on BeginPlay and clears it when the player presses the Stop input action.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_StoppableTimer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DoWork", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Stop"]
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DoWork"]
NODE n5: Event_Custom [EventName=DoWork]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Working"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_StopTimer
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=0.25, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Stop"]
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute {

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay sets a one-shot timer for 10 seconds. When the timer fires, destroy the actor.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SelfDestruct
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SelfDestruct", Time=10.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=SelfDestruct]
NODE n4: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DelayedDestroy", Time=10.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=DelayedDestroy]
NODE n4: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedDestroy
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DelayedDestroy", Time=10.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=DelayedDestroy]
NODE n4: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap starts a retriggerable delay of 3 seconds. When the delay completes, print Timeout. Each new overlap resets the timer.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RetriggerExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: RetriggerableDelay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Timeout"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayReset
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimeout", Time=3.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTimeout]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Timeout"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor] }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayReset
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimeout", Time=3.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTimeout]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Timeout"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsActive. On BeginPlay, check IsActive. If true, set a looping timer every 2 seconds. If false, print Disabled.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalTimer
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Pulse", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Disabled"]
NODE n6: Event_Custom [EventName=Pulse]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Pulse"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalTimer
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Disabled"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay prints Phase 1, waits 2 seconds, prints Phase 2, waits 3 seconds, prints Phase 3, waits 1 second, then destroys itself.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_PhasedSequence
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Phase 1"]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Phase 2"]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Phase 3"]
NODE n7: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n8: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Completed -> n8.Execute

PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Phase 1"]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Phase 2"]
NODE n5: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Phase 3"]
NODE n7: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n8: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Completed -> n8.Execute {

instruction: Create a Blueprint with an integer variable Count starting at 0. Set a looping timer every 1 second. Each time the timer fires, increment Count by 1 and print the count. When Count reaches 5, clear the timer.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountdownTimer
PARENT: Actor
VAR Count: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Tick", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=Tick]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Count]
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Count]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: GreaterThan [B=4]
NODE n9: Branch
NODE n10: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Tick"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n8.A [Int]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CountTimer
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
VAR Count: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTimer]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Count]
NODE n5: AddInt [B=1]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Count]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: GreaterThan [B=5]
NODE n9: Branch
NODE n10: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Int]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Int]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n8.A [Int]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
EXEC n9.False -> n3.Execute {

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay hides the actor, waits 5 seconds, then makes it visible.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedAppear
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=true]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [NewHidden=false]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedShow
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayedShow
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=true]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=5.0]
NODE n4: SetActorHiddenInGame [bNewHidden=false]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Interact toggles a timer on and off. Use a boolean variable TimerRunning to track state.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleTimer
PARENT: Actor
VAR TimerRunning: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=TimerRunning]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DoTick"]
NODE n5: VariableSet [VarName=TimerRunning]
NODE n6: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="DoTick", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n7: VariableSet [VarName=TimerRunning]
NODE n8: Event_Custom [EventName=DoTick]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Tick"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA false -> n5.Value [Bool]
EXEC n3.False -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA true -> n7.Value [Bool]
EXEC n8.Then -> n9.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleTimer
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
VAR TimerRunning: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=0.01, Looping=true]
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick"]
NODE n5: Event_Tick
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n3.Execute }
raw_output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleTimer
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
VAR TimerRunning: Bool = false
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=0.01, Looping=true]
NODE n4: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick"]
NODE n5: Event_Tick
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n3.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay sets a looping timer every 3 seconds. Each time the timer fires, spawn an actor of class BP_Coin at the actor's location.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CoinSpawner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="SpawnCoin", Time=3.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=SpawnCoin]
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Coin]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform]

NODE n5: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Coin]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.SpawnTransform [Transform] }

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Health at 50.0. On BeginPlay start a looping timer every 2 seconds. Each tick add 5 to Health and print the value. When Health reaches 100 or more, clear the timer and print Full Health.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthRegen
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 50.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Regen", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=Regen]
NODE n4: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n5: AddFloat [B=5.0]
NODE n6: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: GreaterThan [B=99.9]
NODE n9: Branch
NODE n10: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Regen"]
NODE n11: PrintString [InString="Full Health"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Then -> n11.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthTimer
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 50.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTick]
NODE n4: GetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n5: AddFloat [B=5.0]
NODE n6: SetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n7: PrintString
NODE n8: GreaterEqualFloat [B=100.0]
NODE n9: Branch
NODE n10: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick"]
NODE n11: PrintString [InString="Full Health"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute
DATA n4.Value -> n5.A [Float]
DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n7.InString [String]
EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Then -> n11.Execute }

PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 50.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTick", Time=2.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTick]

NODE n5: AddFloat [B=5.0]
NODE n6: SetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n7: PrintString

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n6.Execute

DATA n5.ReturnValue -> n6.Value [Float]
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute

EXEC n7.Then -> n9.Execute
DATA n6.Value -> n8.A [Float]
DATA n8.ReturnValue -> n9.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n9.True -> n10.Execute
EXEC n10.Then -> n11.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that when the player presses Interact, prints Action then starts a retriggerable delay of 2 seconds. When the delay completes print Idle. Each press resets the delay.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_IdleDetector
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Action"]
NODE n3: RetriggerableDelay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Idle"]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelayReset
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Action"]
NODE n3: RetriggerableDelay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Idle"]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute }

PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Idle"]

EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay starts a looping timer every 4 seconds. Each time the timer fires, play a sound at the actor's location.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_RepeatingSound
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="PlayBeep", Time=4.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=PlayBeep]
NODE n4: GetActorLocation
NODE n5: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=BeepSound]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Location [Vector]
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TimerSound
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=4.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTimer]
NODE n4: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=SoundCue_Footsteps]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }

CATEGORY: Gameplay
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=4.0, Looping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=OnTimer]
NODE n4: PlaySoundAtLocation [Sound=SoundCue_Footsteps]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a Sequence node. The first output prints Spawned. The second output waits 10 seconds then calls DestroyActor.

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Spawned"]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=10.0]
NODE n5: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate node. On BeginPlay, open the gate and start a looping timer. The timer enters the gate. The gate exit prints Pulse. Pressing Stop closes the gate.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GatedTimer
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="TimerTick", Time=1.0, Looping=true]
NODE n4: Event_Custom [EventName=TimerTick]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Pulse"]
NODE n6: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Stop"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n5.Execute
EXEC n6.Pressed -> n2.Close
actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: OpenGate
NODE n3: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=0.25, Looping=true]
NODE n4: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=Stop]
NODE n5: CloseGate
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Pulse"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n6.Execute>

NODE n4: Event_CustomEvent [EventName=Stop]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n4.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n6.Execute>

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Interact uses a FlipFlop. On the A output, wait 1 second then print On. On the B output, wait 1 second then print Off.

NODE n5: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Off"]

EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Completed -> n6.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that starts a 5-second self-destruct timer on BeginPlay. If the player overlaps the actor before the timer fires, clear the timer and print Saved.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DefuseBomb
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Explode", Time=5.0, Looping=false]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=Explode]
NODE n4: DestroyActor
NODE n5: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n6: ClearTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="Explode"]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Saved"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Then -> n7.Execute
actual_dsl:

GRAPH: EventGraph

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute }

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay prints Initializing and waits 3 seconds then prints Ready. On Tick prints Running. On EndPlay prints Shutting Down.
expected_dsl:

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Initializing"]
NODE n3: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
NODE n5: Event_Tick
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Running"]
NODE n7: Event_EndPlay
NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Shutting Down"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute

NODE n8: PrintString [InString="Shutting Down"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

EXEC n3.Completed -> n4.Execute

EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute }
